[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex, lengthy sentences may impede smooth readability.
[LEXICON]: Formal, archaic vocabulary (e.g., "dross," "melting in the crucible") could slow comprehension for some readers.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unexplained insertion of religious quote disrupts narrative flow.
[TRANSITION]: Sudden shifts (e.g., from industrial era to Reynolds’ Italy influence) lack clear connective tissue.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex, lengthy sentences may impede smooth flow (e.g., "Perhaps we have no right...").
[LEXICON]: Formal tone with archaic language (e.g., "Lion Comique," "prime minister's salary") may slightly challenge modern readability.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt shifts between praising Reynolds’ social connections and criticizing his flaws (e.g., snobbery, jealousy).
[TRANSITION]: Tangential comments (e.g., Leicester Square’s theatricality, music hall analogy) disrupt thematic cohesion.
